metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

<?php// This only works in PHP 7.4 and above$str = "Hello World";
  $my_function = fn($a) => $str . $a;echo $my_function("!");?>

content.code_html:
<?php
// This only works in PHP 7.4 and above
$str = "Hello World";
$my_function = fn($a) => $str . $a;
echo $my_function("!");
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<?php// This only works in PHP 7.4 and above$str = "Hello World";
  $my_function = fn($a) => $str . $a;echo $my_function("!");?>
// This only works in PHP 7.4 and above

content.text: The fn keyword is used to create arrow functions. Arrow functions are only available in PHP versions 7.4 and up.
content.html: The fn keyword is used to create arrow functions. Arrow functions are only available in PHP versions 7.4 and up.

content.text: Arrow functions have access to all variables from the scope in which they were created.
content.html: Arrow functions have access to all variables from the scope in which they were created.

content.text: The general syntax of an arrow function is:
content.html: The general syntax of an arrow function is:

content.code_html: fn(arguments) => expression to be returned;
